bitfield.description: Software End Of Interrupt [EOI] control if pulse interrupts are used. Write 1 to acknowledge interrupt

register.description: RAW Interrupt status. Raw status is set even if interrupt is not enabled. Write 1 to set the RAW status

bitfield.description: VID IRQ STATUS. Register indicates the VIDEO pipeline[s] interrupt events
VP IRQ STATUS. Register indicates the Video Port[s] interrupt events

register.description: Interrupt status. Enabled status, isn't set unless event is enabled. Write 1 to clear the status after interrupt has been serviced. RAW status also gets cleared, i.e. even if not enabled

bitfield.description: VID IRQ STATUS. Register indicates the VIDEO pipeline[s] interrupt events
VP IRQ STATUS. Register indicates the Video Port[s] interrupt events

register.description: SET Interrupt enable. Write 1 to set interrupt enable. Readout equal to corresponding _CLR register

bitfield.description: VID IRQ
VP IRQ

register.description: CLR Interrupt enable. Write 1 to clear interrupt enable

bitfield.description: VID IRQ
VP IRQ

register.description: This register allows to mask/unmask the VID_0 internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis

bitfield.description: Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
Video End Window. This is raised by the DMA engine when the full video data has been sent to the pipeline
Video DMA Buffer Underflow. This is raised when the DMA buffer does not have the data requested by the Video pipeline

register.description: This register allows to mask/unmask the VIDL_0 internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis

bitfield.description: Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
Video End Window. This is raised by the DMA engine when the full video data has been sent to the pipeline
Video DMA Buffer Underflow. This is raised when the DMA buffer does not have the data requested by the Video pipeline

register.description: Security bit settings for different DISPC sub-modules

bitfield.description: Secure bit for OVR
Secure bit for VID
Secure bit for VP [Unused in K3_DSS]

register.description: This register groups all the status of the VID_0 internal events that generate an interrupt. Write 1 to a clear a bit field

bitfield.description: Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
Video End Window. This is raised by the DMA engine when the full video data has been sent to the pipeline
Video DMA Buffer Underflow. This is raised when the DMA buffer does not have the data requested by the Video pipeline

register.description: This register groups all the status of the VID_0 internal events that generate an interrupt. Write 1 to a clear a bit field

bitfield.description: Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
Video End Window. This is raised by the DMA engine when the full video data has been sent to the pipeline
Video DMA Buffer Underflow. This is raised when the DMA buffer does not have the data requested by the Video pipeline

register.description: This register allows to mask/unmask the VP_0 internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis

bitfield.description: Dummy IRQ for future use
Go bit clear event
Security Violation interrupt for OVR/VP. Non-secure OVR/VP connected to secure VID
Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
AC BIAS transition counter has decremented to zero
Synchronization Lost for Video Port
Programmed Line Number. It indicates that the scan of the display has reached the programmed user line number
VSYNC for odd field from interlace mode only
Vertical Synchronization for VP
Frame Done for Video Port. VP output has been disabled by user. All the data have been sent

register.description: This register allows to mask/unmask the VP_1 internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis

bitfield.description: Dummy IRQ for future use
Go bit clear event
Security Violation interrupt for OVR/VP. Non-secure OVR/VP connected to secure VID
Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
AC BIAS transition counter has decremented to zero
Synchronization Lost for Video Port
Programmed Line Number. It indicates that the scan of the display has reached the programmed user line number
VSYNC for odd field from interlace mode only
Vertical Synchronization for VP
Frame Done for Video Port. VP output has been disabled by user. All the data have been sent

register.description: This register groups all the status of the VP_0 internal events that generate an interrupt. Write 1 to a given bit resets this bit

bitfield.description: Dummy IRQ for future use
Go bit clear event
Security Violation IRQ. Non-secure OVR/VP connected to secure VID
Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
AC BIAS transition counter has decremented to zero
Synchronization Lost on VP output. The required data are not output at the correct time due to too short blanking periods or stall of at least one pipelines associated with VP output
Programmed Line Number. It indicates that the scan of the display has reached the programmed user line number
VSYNC for odd field. For interlace mode only
Vertical Synchronization for VP output. It is used as VSYNC_EVEN in case of interlace mode
Frame Done for VP. VP output has been disabled by user All the data have been sent

register.description: This register groups all the status of the VP_1 internal events that generate an interrupt. Write 1 to a given bit resets this bit

bitfield.description: Dummy IRQ for future use
Go bit clear event
Security Violation IRQ. Non-secure OVR/VP connected to secure VID
Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
AC BIAS transition counter has decremented to zero
Synchronization Lost on VP output. The required data are not output at the correct time due to too short blanking periods or stall of at least one pipelines associated with VP output
Programmed Line Number. It indicates that the scan of the display has reached the programmed user line number
VSYNC for odd field. For interlace mode only
Vertical Synchronization for VP output. It is used as VSYNC_EVEN in case of interlace mode
Frame Done for VP. VP output has been disabled by user All the data have been sent
